Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo, Permanente,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Productor Audiovisual Cinépolis te invita a vivir la mejor película de tu vida formando parte de una de las empresas más importantes a nivel Global. Cinépolis®, somos la empresa en exhibición cinematográfica más grande de América Latina y la cuarta a nivel mundial, tenemos presencia en 13 países (México, Estados Unidos, España, India, Brasil, Guatemala, El Salvador, Costa Rica, Honduras, Panamá, Colombia, Perú y Chile), reconocida como una súper empresa para trabajar. 	Técnico JR Ruta Cinépolis	 Lugar de trabajo: Santa Fe, CDMX Requisitos:Técnico o Ing. en Audio, Electrónica o Video Experiencia mínima de 1 año como responsable técnico en proyectos audiovisuales o escénicos, tecnología, audiovisual y producción técnica Conocimiento en el manejo de vehículos de 3.5 toneladas (contar con licencia vigente) Amplia disponibilidad para viajar a nivel nacional  Objetivo General del puesto:Implementar funciones de cine, en comunidades rurales y urbanas, del programa social "Ruta Cinépolis", bajo un formato de cine móvil siguiendo los procesos operativos, logísticos y administrativos de Fundación Cinépolis para asegurar la calidad audiovisual establecida en cada uno de los eventos. Actividades Específicas:Apoyar los procesos técnicos y operativos para uno de los equipos de video proyección y sonido del programa, asegurando la calidad ideal en cada uno de los eventos, conocer y ejecutar conexiones para sistemas de sonido, video proyección y electrónicos. Alinearse al manual operativo y corporativo del programa para la producción de funciones de cineApoyo en la realización de comprobaciones de gastos mediante facturación de consumos y presentar un reporte de costos al finalizas los circuitos de funciones asignadosApoyar al responsable del equipo (técnico SR) en la elaboración de listas de inventario, reporte de incidencias técnicas y apoyar en la logística para mejora y mantenimiento de los equiposCumplir con el plan de capacitación técnica, asignado por la Coordinación de Ruta Cinépolis, para desarrollar las habilidades necesarias para el puestoApoyar al responsable del equipo (técnico SR) en la logística del traslado para cada uno de los eventos tales como búsqueda de hospedaje, restaurantes, trazo de ruta en GPS e incidencias durante el trasladoAportar retroalimentación e información relevante técnica para la elaboración de planea de trabajo que cumplan con las necesidades técnicas, logísticas y administrativas de Fundación CinépolisGenerar un dialogo directo con los aliados estratégicos de Ruta Cinépolis para cumplir con los estándares de calidad establecidos en el programa, tomando en cuenta variables técnicas y operativasBrindar información clave a la Coordinación de Ruta Cinépolis para la toma de decisiones respecto a la mejora de la tecnología y recursos empleados en el programaRepresentar a Fundación Cinépolis en cada uno de los eventos asignados  Vive tus sueños.#CinépolisEntraCinepolisjobs

Product Supply Supervisor- Irapuato Plant México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Productor Audiovisual PRODUCT SUPPLY SUPERVISOR - IRAPUATO PLANT


DESCRIPTION
Have you ever found yourself crafting new ideas from insights around you? Do you see beauty in the form and function of products on the store shelf? Do you want to work for the biggest fabric of Blades and Razors in the world? You will love this role.

Because our Plants are ideal places to work, where innovation and creativity drive everything we do, kick off a challenging and rewarding engineering career with Gillette, in Irapuato Plant!

Gillette is a highly recognized organization with billion-dollar brand successes (Mach3, Fusion, Venus).
WHAT DOES THE WORK LOOK LIKE?
Our Product Supply group is responsible for the manufacture and delivery of all our products. It's the bread and butter of what makes P&G such a great company to work for. From the first day on the job, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with our Manufacturing groups.

We're looking for a few different roles in the Product Supply space:
Process Engineers: Your work here would include developing innovative solutions geared towards improving our product designs. You'll be building transformation models and evaluating and designing process equipment. We're typically looking for someone from a chemical engineering background for these roles.

Converting Engineers: Your work here would include developing innovative web processing equipment solutions which deliver superior consumer driven product designs.

Packing Engineers: You work here would include developing innovative packaging equipment solutions which deliver superior consumer driven products and highly efficient production systems. Typically, someone here would be an electrical or mechanical engineer.

Control System Engineers: Do you want to build some cool automation systems, control information networks, or vision and robotic systems? Engineers here use mechatronics and process dynamic simulation tools to create industrial software solutions that enable efficient production. Typically, these are electrical, mechanical, or chemical engineering roles.

Every role provides opportunities to lead technical programs and designs. You will coordinate production teams, building capabilities and developing technicians to create flexible, loss free, working safely organizations achieving business requirements.
WHAT WE OFFER:
All positions are managerial entry level roles.
A wide range of challenging engineering assignments in one of the most influential companies in the world. We don't just offer a job, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities
Significant work from your first day in P&G and every day learning.
Environment multifunctional teamwork and high level of interaction with managers and directors who will develop your skills
Competitive salary and a benefit package.
Dynamic and respectful international work environment ? employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.
JUST SO YOU KNOW:
You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.

Immigration sponsorship is not available for this position. Procter & Gamble does not sponsor candidates for permanent residency. Any exceptions would be based on the Company's specific business needs at the time and place of recruitment as well as the qualifications of the individual.

Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals based on race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in unrivaled ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours.


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
Newly graduated or maximum 4 years of experience.
Any Engineering degree (Electrical, Chemical, Mechanical, Industrial, Mechatronics or any related field of engineering).
Intermediate / Advanced English.
Technical mastery and interpersonal /communication skills.
Live in Irapuato or willing to relocate.

Job locations:
Irapuato, Guanajuato
Job Type: Full-time
Req No: SNO00002763

? Discussion/Alignment/Communication on all matters towards supplier and customers

? Experience working in a DEV/OPS environment

? Service Management competencies including expectation and risk mgmt.
? Provider Management Skills
? Customer/provider relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., customer centricity, conflict management, leadership and challenger)

Product Supply Supervisor- Irapuato Plant México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Productor Audiovisual PRODUCT SUPPLY SUPERVISOR - IRAPUATO PLANT


DESCRIPTION
Have you ever found yourself crafting new ideas from insights around you? Do you see beauty in the form and function of products on the store shelf? Do you want to work for the biggest fabric of Blades and Razors in the world? You will love this role.

Because our Plants are ideal places to work, where innovation and creativity drive everything we do, kick off a challenging and rewarding engineering career with Gillette, in Irapuato Plant!

Gillette is a highly recognized organization with billion-dollar brand successes (Mach3, Fusion, Venus).
WHAT DOES THE WORK LOOK LIKE?
Our Product Supply group is responsible for the manufacture and delivery of all our products. It's the bread and butter of what makes P&G such a great company to work for. From the first day on the job, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with our Manufacturing groups.

We're looking for a few different roles in the Product Supply space:
Process Engineers: Your work here would include developing innovative solutions geared towards improving our product designs. You'll be building transformation models and evaluating and designing process equipment. We're typically looking for someone from a chemical engineering background for these roles.

Converting Engineers: Your work here would include developing innovative web processing equipment solutions which deliver superior consumer driven product designs.

Packing Engineers: You work here would include developing innovative packaging equipment solutions which deliver superior consumer driven products and highly efficient production systems. Typically, someone here would be an electrical or mechanical engineer.

Control System Engineers: Do you want to build some cool automation systems, control information networks, or vision and robotic systems? Engineers here use mechatronics and process dynamic simulation tools to create industrial software solutions that enable efficient production. Typically, these are electrical, mechanical, or chemical engineering roles.

Every role provides opportunities to lead technical programs and designs. You will coordinate production teams, building capabilities and developing technicians to create flexible, loss free, working safely organizations achieving business requirements.
WHAT WE OFFER:
All positions are managerial entry level roles.
A wide range of challenging engineering assignments in one of the most influential companies in the world. We don't just offer a job, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities
Significant work from your first day in P&G and every day learning.
Environment multifunctional teamwork and high level of interaction with managers and directors who will develop your skills
Competitive salary and a benefit package.
Dynamic and respectful international work environment ? employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.
JUST SO YOU KNOW:
You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.

Immigration sponsorship is not available for this position. Procter & Gamble does not sponsor candidates for permanent residency. Any exceptions would be based on the Company's specific business needs at the time and place of recruitment as well as the qualifications of the individual.

Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals based on race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in unrivaled ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours.


QUALIFICATIONS
Mexican citizenship, currently living in Mexico City
Newly graduated or maximum 4 years of experience.
Any Engineering degree (Electrical, Chemical, Mechanical, Industrial, Mechatronics or any related field of engineering).
Intermediate / Advanced English.
Technical mastery and interpersonal /communication skills.
Live in Irapuato or willing to relocate.

Job locations:
Irapuato, Guanajuato
Job Type: Full-time
Req No: SNO00002763

Your challenge will be?
? Responsible for Team Backlog and priorities

? Build/support effective Agile team and its interfaces (PO, PM, SM, Architect, Dev.Team)
? Contributes in business cases
? Ensure quality
? Brings together system knowledge and customer needs (old: Demand management)
? Budget ownership and full technical and commercial responsibility (incl. planning/forecasting)
? User base, Time reporting, Internal/External KPI, Shopping Cards (old: operations management)

? Plan, align and track releases (old: release management)

? Overall ownership and approval on all matters regarding IT Service (e.g. signs off all relevant SLAs/OLAs/KPIs, approve Service Prices and customer allocation)
? Responsibility for recovering all costs of his Service
? Discussion/Alignment/Communication on all matters towards supplier and customers
? Align with other teams / Tool Managers / Customersdowntimes of systems etc.. (old: availability management)
? Ensure Patch management
? Manages services provided by external providers? Deployment pipelines for Infrastructure as Code

? Excellent communication, presentation, and customer management skills with advanced problem solving skills
? Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
? Written and spoken English on negotiation level is a must, additional language like German is a plus
? Experience with Agile methodologies
? Experience working in a DEV/OPS environment
? Entrepreneurial competencies: (lateral) leadership skills, output orientation, value oriented  and user satisfaction driven, assertiveness, visionary, driver, analytical, negotiation skills, business admin and commercial capabilities, holistic view
? Service Management competencies including expectation and risk mgmt.
? Provider Management Skills
? Customer/provider relationship management soft skills (Stakeholder mgmt., customer centricity, conflict management, leadership and challenger)

Coordinador de Experiencia de Marca | BUNA café rico Ciudad de México (Distrito Federal) $25,000 - $30,000 Mensual  Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Comunicación e Imagen Acerca de BUNA:Nos dedicamos a trabajar con el campo mexicano para desarrollar, transformar y compartir café rico. Empezamos en el 2012 trabajando con café y distribuyendo La Marzocco, muy pronto empezamos a explorar la transformación de otros cultivos agrícolas, con los que ahora también trabajamos. Trabajamos en México, el lugar común de la compañía, de aquí somos y aquí nos queremos quedar, para desde aquí compartirlo con el mundo. Recorremos los ecosistemas del país para aprender de su biodiversidad y suelos. Le dedicamos tiempo a encontrar las mejores materias primas. Colaboramos con los agricultores para implementar prácticas agroecológicas y diseñar procesos de calidad para su cosecha. Construimos relaciones fuertes y acuerdos justos para comprar, transformar y compartir café rico. Vamos al lugar de donde venimos. Vamos al lugar de donde vivimos.Estamos certificados como compañía B. Creemos en usar los negocios para generar cambio positivo. Propósito de la vacante:Diseñar y desarrollar la marca Buna como una experiencia de hacer compañía. Entendemos marca como toda interacción que tiene una persona con la organización. El propósito es crear los lineamientos de marca, y llevarlos a vida con actividades y hábitos diarios, que permitan que el equipo se alinie entorno a un propósito común, y actúe dentro de los valores y cultura de nuestra empresa. Principales responsabilidades:Desarrollo e implementación de una estrategia de experiencia de marca para todos los stakeholders de Buna (internos y externos), alineada a la cultura organizacional de la empresa. Definición de línea editorial de comunicación.Curación de la "voz" y estilo de comunicación.Crear contenidos para comunicación.Participar en la creación de campañas de promoción.Gestionar la implementación de actividades que promueven la cultura deseada.Requisitos:Buscamos profesional con competencias y capacidades demostrables por sobre estudios o diplomas.Talento en diseno grafico o en su carencia poder gestionar este servicio con diseñadores.PuntualesEficacesSensibilidad artistica. Bilingues (espanol/ingles) con buena ortografia, diccion y gramatica en ambos idiomas. Creatividad para contenidos originales y disruptivos. Inspirados por companias con un proposito claro y vinculado a la gastronomia y agricultura. Usan la colaboración como herramienta para lograr sus objetivos (se preguntan; ¿qué puedo hacer por el equipo? en vez de ¿qué puede hacer el equipo por mi?) Extrovertidos, buenos con las personas, traen el "charm" que deja a todos encantados.  Se valora perfil emprendedor: Actitud proactiva, líder, con alto sentido de pertenencia con la organización. Empatía y espíritu de servicio.Apertura al cambio, flexibilidad y capacidad de interactuar con personas de todos los nivelesAlta capacidad de liderazgoAlta capacidad de trabajo en equipo Creatividad e innovaciónAlta recursividad y capacidad de trabajo en ambientes de poca información e incertidumbre y en entornos culturales diversos.Se ofrece:Crecimiento continuo; personal y profesional. Product Supply Supervisor- Vallejo Plant México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Productor Audiovisual COMPUTER ENGINEERING FOR MANUFACTURING


DESCRIPTION
Are you looking for a role that will encourage you to become an IT expert?

In this role, you will lead all IT operations in our site and will collaborate with local resources to support IT components in the OT space. You will get along with Product Supply's and Global Business Services' functions.

You will be accountable for the following IT focus areas at the plant:
End to End IT operation
Operational excellence IT & OT Infrastructure & Networking
Systemic remediation of IT issues
IT Continuity planning (avoid unplanned downtime)
IT Compliance, Cybersecurity vulnerability, & Info Security
Our work plan is aligned with the site priorities and will require technical deep understanding to execute IT technical work. The leader will balance capacity in line with local needs and global GBS focus area.

What are the Technical Responsibilities?
Incident Management & Resolution: Demonstrate accountability and ownership to lead most technical incidents to resolution within the technical area and work with the team to pursue more complex or cross-technology incidents. Demonstrate deep understanding and critical thinking skills in solving issues related to applications, computing and network.
Issue Management: Minimize impact to business by identifying potential critical issues and alert management purposefully, elevating to right operation team.
Problem Management: Begin to dedicatedly and reactively provide solutions to prevent problems from occurring in area of responsibility, inter-operating with the our business and operating standards, key personnel and partners.
Implementation: Responsible for implementing and leading IT change for his/her site (review, approve, control quality of execution)
Continuous improvement: Find opportunities to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of the IT/OT operations and work closely with IT Operations Leader & P&G TSP to deliver the agreed continuous improvement plan
Solution Design: Single point of contact for special project coordinator as consultant for local infrastructure needs within area(s) of technical responsibility.
Stewardship: Responsible for timely closure of the issues with quality. Support local Audit on all IT topics
Governance of Operational partners at site: lead local/global operational resources that deliver IT operations at site.
Service Operations: Lead applications and infrastructure components in a production environment. ITIL Foundation Certified would be helpful.
Application & Integration:Analyze and resolve integration needs through different application (local/global)
IT/OT Infrastructure Domain Expertise:Deep understanding of IT infrastructure with a strong desire to improve an expertise that is now recognized as a critical skill in the new IT career model. This includes NT servers, Networking, Firewalls, Voice, Mobility and Personal Computing.
Teamwork/Vendor /Partner Management: You will work in a highly matrix organization where boundaries are sometimes unclear. Works well across teams functions, and organizations and is seen by others as a proven team player.
Leadership:Ability to work effectively in a 'start-up' type environment. This role will play a huge part in fine-tuning this new role and identifying the work processes and business processes necessary to ensure Operational Excellence in a Plant environment.
Project Management:Ability to successfully deliver small to medium projects.
IT Security & Risk: awareness of cybersecurity requirement and support local cybersecurity team into the remediation plan
Basic in IT stewardship requirement and controls.
Do you have the skills needed to perform this job?
Communication
Risk Analysis ? Ability to analyze the risk to operations vs. the cost to prevent it and develop standard methodologies with policy-makers on IT Continuity standards.
Ownership & Accountability ? High level of capability for independent work, priority setting and ability to meet deadlines. Ability to flow to the work depending on business situation.
Self Starter ? Need to be able to handle onboarding quickly to a complex and dynamic environment.
Just so you know:

We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours.

Are you ready to inspire us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS
Recent graduates of engineering majors ? Information, electronic, etc.
Or, graduates with no more than 3 years of experience.

México, Distrito Federal
Job Type: Full-time

Product Supply Supervisor México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Permanente,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Productor Audiovisual PRODUCT SUPPLY SUPERVISOR


DESCRIPTION
We are seeking talents to our Plants for the position of
Product Supply Supervisor
Managerial full-time position
Start date: as soon as possible
Work schedule: full-time with flexible working hours
Profile: Any Engineer degree (Electrical, Chemical, Mechanical, Industrial, Mechatronics or any related field of engineering).
Qualifications: Newly graduated or maximum 4 years of experience. (preferably in consumer goods corporations).
Description:
Are you ready to unleash your technical creativity?
Innovation is the driving force behind everything we do at P&G. Across the world, you will find thousands of engineers and developers working in manufacturing plants, innovation centers and distribution facilities.
You'll be in the ideal place to work on groundbreaking improvements related to the manufacturing and processing of our leading products with smart, connected technologies driving the 4th industrial revolution. Our aim is to ignite your potential and equip you to enhance the capability, safety and productivity of all our systems while reducing cost and boosting sustainability.
What does the work look like?
Our Product Supply group is responsible for the manufacture and delivery of all our products. It's the bread and butter of what makes P&G such a great company to work for. From the first day on the job, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with our Manufacturing groups.
We're looking for a few different roles in the Product Supply space:
Process Engineers: Your work here would include developing innovative solutions geared towards improving our product designs. You'll be building transformation models and evaluating and designing process equipment. We're typically looking for someone from a chemical engineering background for these roles.
Converting Engineers: Your work here would include developing innovative web processing equipment solutions which deliver superior consumer driven product designs.
Packing Engineers: You work here would include developing innovative packaging equipment solutions which deliver superior consumer driven products and highly efficient production systems. Typically, someone here would be an electrical or mechanical engineer.
Control System Engineers: Do you want to build some cool automation systems, control information networks, or vision and robotic systems? Engineers here use mechatronics and process dynamic simulation tools to create industrial software solutions that enable efficient production. Typically, these are electrical, mechanical, or chemical engineering roles.
What would make you a great fit?
Technical mastery and interpersonal /communication skills.
You know how to set priorities and deliver what you commit to.
You love working in a multicultural and diverse environment.
What we offer:
All positions are entry level management roles.
A wide range of challenging engineering assignments in one of the most influential companies in the world. We don't just offer a job, we offer a career with varying assignments and lots of development opportunities
Significant work from your first day in P&G and every day learning.
Environment multifunctional teamwork and high level of interaction with managers and directors who will develop your skills
Competitive salary and a benefit package.
Dynamic and respectful international work environment ? employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.

If you are interested, please JOIN US by submitting your application below!
Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/pgmexico/
Just so you now:
We are an equal opportunity employer. We don't discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. Our people are all equally talented in extraordinary ways: we come from diverse traditions, personal experiences and points of view. And we want to include yours. Are you ready to encourage us with your ideas?


QUALIFICATIONS

Mexican citizenship.
Newly graduated or maximum 4 years of experience.
Any Engineering degree (Electrical, Chemical, Mechanical, Industrial, Mechatronics or any related field of engineering).
Advanced English.
Live in Mexico City since plants are in CDMX
Job locations:
México, Distrito Federal
Job Type: Full-time
Req No: SNO00002764

Commercial Events & Incentive Programs Coordinator Mexico City, México Salario no mostrado por compañía. Descripción de la vacante Contratación: Tiempo Completo, Permanente,  Categoría: Comunicaciones,  Comunicación e Imagen ¿Do you want to be part of one of the most important foods and beverages companies of the world?  PepsiCo is a global leader in foods and beverages with a portfolio of 22 brands that generate more million dollars per year. Today we are looking for our next:  Commercial Events & Incentive Programs Coordinator  Main Purpose -  This role is responsible for supporting, coordinating and planning the commercial communication and incentive events for Latam, this role is responsible for the alignment of all OU Commercial Events & Incentives to the same LATAM Commercial Strategy. This role is responsible for designing, planning, coordinating and executing LATAM central managed Commercial Events ROH, Super Bowl, UCLF, and other Commercial Communication & Recognition programs for our sales representatives and customers across LATAM. This role will be the Control and monitoring tower for all expenses related to Commercial Events & Incentives, consolidating information to provide visibility, standardizing KPIs (ROI, Sales Growth, Customer Satisfaction Index, Pending Payments, etc.) and processes, to report results to the LATAM CCO Sales Strategy team.  Main Accountabilities -

Design the toolkits for the Sales Conventions of the OUs
Coordinates the general design for the event
Recognizes and Incentives the sales force from the beginning of the year according to the sales growth's targets from the OUs
Coordinates the logistics for the Sports Events (Superbowl, UEFA CL, Tennis Opens) to grant the incentives to employees and consumers who have been selected through the local sales contests
Coordinates the Ring of Honor logistics, partners with global and is the point person for the sector to integrate the documentations and information of every participant (+36) of the sector, working with the OUs to meet deadlines and information submission
Maps and documents the process to ensure standardization and consistence in the planning and execution of every OU
Ensures execution meet policies and execution standards to ensure consistent participants selection criteria for the events and incentive programs
Control and Monitors the KPIs for the executed events in the OUs to ensure measurable KPIs of the performance of each event or incentive program.
Align the CCO agenda with the operational needs of the OUs for the deployment of the action plan and annual objective setting

Experience at least of 2 years in Commercial Events design and coordination
Experience in Communication and Digital Media

Knowledge in managing customers and vendors
